Boston.com
10

O'Malley approves plan to regroup Boston archdiocese

The head of the Boston archdiocese has accepted a plan to group 288 parishes into about 135 clusters and assign a clergy staff to each of them. (Boston Globe)
  • Watch O'Malley discusses the reorganization
  • Live chat with Cardinal O'Malley Friday at 1 p.m.

Israeli troops move toward Gaza

Palestinian militants barraged Israel with more than 200 rockets, killing three, as Israel pressed airstrikes on militant targets across the Gaza Strip. (AP)
  • Violence in Israel challenges US-Egypt ties
  • Israel and Hamas battle on social media as well

10 ways to a better holiday meal

Sometimes the only things your holiday dinner needs to improve dramatically are some simple changes.

La. governor blasts Romney 'gift' remarks

The GOP's Bobby Jindal, who stumped for Mitt Romney, assailed him for saying President Obama won due to "gifts" to minorities and young people. (Boston Globe)
  • 11/14 Romney: Gifts' to minorities, youth helped Obama
  • Top Republicans say Romney didn't offer specifics
  • Obama hopes to meet with Romney before year's out

Hewitt suspended from Tennis Hall of Fame after allegations of sexual abuse

Disgraced tennis star Bob Hewitt allegedly sexually abused underage girls he coached, from Greater Boston to his native South Africa, from the 1970s to the 1990s. (Boston Globe)
  • 8/28/11 Hewitt trailed by allegations

CIA to investigate conduct of Petraeus

The agency is opening an "exploratory" investigation into the general conduct of David Petraeus, who resigned as CIA director after admitting an affair. (AP)
  • Pentagon orders ethics training review for top officers
  • Pictures Petraeus timeline | More notable sex scandals

for medication sources
